page.title: 05Upper Lutheredge Pleasure.
page.content: The grassland is not highly productive and the family earn their living from the arable land.The farmer tries to keep it as near to nature as possible. A brook was dammed in 1964 to form a small lake.The lake is kept at a certain level to give the land a chance to drain.The steep banks are terraced to prevent the banks crumbling. The water level falls in a dry season.In the valley there is a Hydraulic Ram by which water is sent via the pump-house to the farmhouse. The farmer hopes that the farm will remain as non-intensively farmed as possible.He enjoys walking by the lake and admiring the bluebells on a Saturday evening. The hills are used for tobogganing in the Winter.
